intro: Peckia purpurea, commonly known as the purple peckia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, with five lobes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Peckia purpurea is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of ponds.
